page.title: 19THORPE HALL,SOUTH ELKINGTON
page.content: Elizabethan house with 17 acres of parkland and 2 acres put to horticultural use, supplying owner's hotel.Surplus is sold on site.Owners since 1983 are hoteliers in Skegness. They are restoring the property and park with sensitivity, and researching the history of Thorpe Hall.They feel that the proposed Louth bypass would give welcome relief from traffic noise and vibration. The{Dovecote}with foundations of stone from a previous house on the site is a listed building.The well documented "{Green Lady,}"ghost of a Spanish lady who enamoured of Sir John Bolle gave him jewellery and a portrait of herself in a green dress.She followed him from Cadiz in 1587 and finding him happily married,entered a nunnery,and later died.Ballad engraved on study windows.Believed to haunt the area.
